title: Packers: Received $432.6M in revenue sharing
content: The Packers, the NFL's only publicly owned team, revealed Wednesday that the national revenue sharing from the previous fiscal year was a record $432.6 million.

title: Griner honored in Phoenix return as Dream win
content: In her first game back in Phoenix, where she played 11 seasons and won a title, Brittney Griner had 17 points to lead the Dream to a 90-79 win on Wednesday night.

title: Rays option Bradley to minors after rough start
content: The Rays optioned Taj Bradley to Triple-A Durham following a poor start for the inconsistent right-hander Wednesday night.

title: Clean slate: Rockies get 1st shutout in 221 games
content: Rookie right-hander Tanner Gordon led the way as the Rockies recorded their first shutout in 221 games, ending the third-longest streak without one in MLB history.

title: USC freshman Arenas injures knee, out 6-8 months
content: USC freshman Alijah Arenas, who was the No. 13 recruit in the ESPN 100, will need surgery after injuring his knee and will sit out six to eight months, the school announced.

title: Ohtani ties Dodgers' mark with HR in 5th straight
content: Shohei Ohtani homered for the fifth consecutive game, becoming the seventh player in Dodgers franchise history to accomplish that feat.

title: Aggies' collie mascot has surgery to remove eye
content: Reveille X, Texas A&M's beloved collie mascot, was resting comfortably after having her right eye surgically removed after being diagnosed with glaucoma.

title: Passan's ultimate MLB trade deadline preview: Where all 30 teams stand, best fits and latest intel
content: From the contenders to the rebuilders, here's what every front office is thinking ahead of the July 31 deadline.

content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

content: Aitana Bonmat√≠ struck an extra-time winner to send Spain into Sunday's Euro 2025 final against England at the expense of eight-time winners Germany.

content: England's super-subs saved the day with minutes to go against Italy as the Lionesses snuck into the Euro final.

content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Manchester United's U.S. preseason tour: Amorim's goals, players to watch
content: Manchester United and Ruben Amorim have arrived in the U.S. aiming to lay the groundwork for a rebound after a dismal 2024-25 campaign.

title: Bonmati: Spain had intel on Berger for winner
content: Spain's match-winner Aitana Bonmat√≠ said she knew Germany goalkeeper Ann-Katrin Berger would leave space at her near post after scoring the goal which sets up a European Championship final against England on Sunday.

title: Rashford joins Barcelona: 'Feels like I'm at home'
content: Barcelona have completed the signing of Manchester United and England forward Marcus Rashford on a season-long loan, the Catalan club confirmed

title: Garber: MLS won't rush 'seismic' calendar shift
content: MLS commissioner Don Garber reiterated that a change to the league's calendar will not likely come until after the 2026 World Cup, insisting that a "seismic" shift like that would take time to implement.

title: Chicharito fined amid backlash over sexist remarks
content: Chivas striker Javier "Chicharito" Hernandez has been fined following an investigation by Mexico's federation into sexist remarks he made online.

title: Cameroon coach not quitting, blames email hack
content: Marc Brys has denied he has quit as coach of Cameroon despite the country's football federation confirming his exit on Wednesday, as the Belgian said his email was likely hacked.

title: Bar√ßa cancel Japan friendly citing contract breach
content: Barcelona have suspended the Japan part of this month's Asia tour due to what the club said was a serious breach of contract by the promoter.

title: Odunze, McCarthy among favorite breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Scheffler's dominance, players to watch and how the Ryder Cup teams look
content: What's next for Scottie Scheffler? Who are the locks for Bethpage, and who has work to do? Following The Open, we look ahead to the rest of the 2025 golf season.

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: Most of the NHL free agent deals are handed out July 1. But there are still some players left -- here are the top remaining unrestricted free agents.

title: Jets go high-tech (and old-school) with locker room redesign
content: A barbershop, along with customized video screens and lockers give the Jets' new locker room a modern-meets-retro feel.

title: Betting buzz: Dallas Cowboys' season win total lowest since 2003
content: The Cowboys' win total for this season has dropped to 7.5 at ESPN BET, the lowest preseason win total for a Cowboys team since 2003.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

content: Son Heung-Min, 33, has been linked with a move to MLS side LAFC. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: The opening of the transfer window offers a reminder that signing a big-name player won't cut it in MLS these days.

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: Tom Aspinall booked his first title defense, but is it the right matchup?
content: The UFC 320 and UFC 321 headliners have been announced. Brett Okamoto reacts to the three upcoming title fights.

title: Pound for pound: Shakur, 'Bam' Rodriguez move up after exciting wins
content: Oleksandr Usyk is still No. 1, but where do Shakur Stevenson and Jesse Rodriguez land? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Divisional: Pacquiao reenters welterweight top 10
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas surges into the top 5
content: 11 five-star prospects have declared, including two recent commits . the longhorns are making themselves comfortable within SEC country . they landed running back Derrick Cooper, a one-time Georgia commit . Texas flipped ESPN 300 DT James Johnson from the Bulldogs, which helped spur the Horns' leap in the rankings .

title: Browns unveil new 'Alpha Dawg' helmets, will don in three regular-season games
content: the helmet, called "Alpha Dawg," will be worn three times in the upcoming 2025 season . the helmet features an all-brown matte shell with a brown stripe between two orange stripes in the middle . it's the first timothy robertson helmet to be worn in the 2025 .

title: Ranking best deadline rentals: CC Sabathia on Brewers? JD Martinez with D-backs?
content: the third baseman for the Arizona Diamondbacks is now challenging Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge for the major league lead in home runs . if they do, Suarez could become one of the more impactful trade-deadline acquisitions we've seen . only five players have ever been traded in the middle of a 40-year period .

title: Zubimendi joined Arsenal after rejecting Liverpool. Can he end their title wait?
content: arsenal manager Mikel Arteta believes new signing Martn Zubimendi joins the club . the club's away kit launch on Monday took place at NOVA Rooftop in Singapore . it is the only tangible improvement they can make after three consecutive second-place finishes in the premier league .

title: Dynasty rankings: Top 300 players for 2025 and beyond
content: my points-league rankings for 2025 are for fantasy managers in dynasty/keeper leagues who are looking ahead to the winter roster cut-down . in this space, I rank players for the next five-plus seasons, serving as an effective price guide . this space uses the following player valuation formula: Rest-of-2025 performance: 10% . 2027 performance: 22.5%. 2028 performance: 22,5% .

title: üëü Clark surprises Iowa with Nike Kobe 5 Protros
content: WNBA star caitlin Clark surprised the Iowa Hawkeyes men's and women's basketball teams . she has consistently sported the Kobe Bryant signature shoe since her college days at Iowa . "it's not eve," she said last season .

title: 'I felt like I needed to smoke a cigarette sometimes': Untold NFL holdout stories
content: future Hall of Fame offensive tackle Walter Jones spotted something in a newspaper that changed everything about his holdout in 2002 . he was trying to secure a long-term deal from the Seattle Seahawks . but he read something that compelled him to sign a deal that same day: the amount of money he had forfeited .

title: EA College Football 26 review roundup: Improvement on all fronts
content: this year's iteration of the series stands at 83 on Metacritic based on 13 reviews on PS5 . the Xbox Series X|S version is noticeably less well regarded with 79 Metascore . opencritic lists CFB 26 with an average top critic score of 84 across platforms .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Rattler, Pickett get No. 1 reps amid QB battles
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams . ari | ATL | BAL | BUF | CAR | CHI | CIN CLE | DAL | DEN | DET | GB | HOU | IND .

title: Cement Maker ACC Net Profit Climbs 4.35% In April-June Quarter
content: Cement maker ACC Ltd on Thursday reported a 4.35 per cent increase in its consolidated net profit to Rs 375.42 crore for the June 2025 quarter, helped by volume gains and operational efficiencies.

title: Narendra Modi UK Visit LIVE: PM Modi, UK's Starmer To Sign Landmark Free Trade Deal Soon
content: PM Narendra Modi UK and Maldives Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a four-day visit to the United Kingdom and the Maldives.

title: "Helmet Peheniye, Saiyaara Ko Bhi Pehnaiye ": UP Police's Twist On Blockbuster Scene Wins Internet
content: The Uttar Pradesh Police in a post on X borrowed a scene from the film Saiyaara to promote the importance of wearing helmets while riding two-wheelers.

title: A Timeline Of The 20-Year-Old Investigation Into The Jeffrey Epstein Case
content: Interest in the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation has exploded over the past month, even as President Donald Trump urged the public and media to move on from a saga he sees as "pretty boring."

title: Trump Admin Cancels $4.9B Loan Guarantee For Green Power Project
content: The Trump administration on Wednesday cancelled a $4.9 billion federal loan guarantee for a new high-voltage transmission line for delivering solar and wind-generated electricity from the Midwest to the eastern US.

title: Adani University Ushers In Industry-Ready Cohort With 'Navdiksha 2025'
content: Adani University has inaugurated its academic induction programme, 'Navdiksha 2025', welcoming a fresh cohort of students into its flagship integrated BTech MBA/M Tech programmes.

title: "Robbed Of Innocence": Cabin Crew Sentenced For Filming Minors In Lavatory
content: A flight attendant accused of taping his cellphone to the lid of an airplane toilet to secretly film young girls was sentenced to just under 20 years in prison Wednesday.

title: Rights Groups Warn Of Starvation In Gaza Amid Israeli Strikes That Killed 29
content: More than 100 charity and human rights groups said that Israel's blockade and ongoing military offensive are pushing Palestinians in the Gaza Strip toward starvation, as Israeli strikes killed another 29 people overnight.

title: 'Unshakable Proof': Intelligence Chief Gabbard On Trump-Russia Probe
content: As the national intelligence director, Tulsi Gabbard is responsible for guarding America's secrets and discovering threats from overseas. But when she made a surprise appearance in the White House briefing room Wednesday

title: The Emerald Triangle Dispute: Why Thailand And Cambodia Are Fighting Again
content: At least one Thai civilian was killed and three others injured on Thursday as Cambodia launched rockets and artillery in retaliation for Thailand's airstrikes on Cambodian military positions.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 4 Live: Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha Adjourned Till Tomorrow
content: The proceedings of Lok Sabha as well as Rajya Sabha have been adjourned till 11:00 am on July 25 amid protest from the opposition members.¬†

title: PM Modi, UK's Starmer To Sign Landmark Free Trade Deal Soon: 10 Points
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on his fourth visit to the UK since taking office in 2014 and will hold talks with his UK counterpart Keir Starmer. The two sides will sign the Free Trade Agreement shortly

title: Rajasthan Man Brutally Assaults His Mother, Ignores Cries Of Children
content: A shocking video from Rajasthan's Kota has sparked outrage after it captured a man brutally attacking his mother. The disturbing footage, which has gone viral on social media, shows the accused, Deepu Mehra, assaulting his mother.

title: Kolhapuris To Banarsis: How Trade Deal With UK Put "Brand India" On Global Map
content: Protecting and promoting the "Brand India"-- from Kohlapuri Chappals to Banarsi and Chanderi textiles-- is a massive priority in the India-UK Free Trade Agreement set to be signed on Thursday in London.

title: "Pure Racism": Woman Who Helped Indian Man After Mob Attack In Ireland
content: The Indian man, who was brutally attacked by a mob in Ireland's Dublin over the weekend, was falsely accused of being a paedophile before being stabbed in the face and stripped naked, according to the woman who rescued him.

title: US Couple Perform Sexual Acts In Front Of Children Mid-Flight, Arrested
content: A Connecticut couple was arrested last week for allegedly performing sexual acts in full view of two children and their mother, aboard a JetBlue flight.

title: CBI Probing 'Tampering Of Evidence' In RG Kar Rape-Murder Case
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probing the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata last year is also looking at a possible larger conspiracy to tamper with evidence.

title: 12-Year-Old Asks Father To Pay 1 Crore For Custody, Top Court Warns Mother
content: Hearing a child custody case, Chief Justice of India BR Gavai warned a 12-year-old girl's mother against "spoiling her mind" after the child demanded Rs 1 crore from her father if he wanted her to stay with him

title: Immerse Ganesha Idols Upto 6 Feet High In Artificial Tanks: Bombay High Court
content: The Bombay High Court on Thursday ordered the immersion of all idols of up to six feet in height in artificial tanks starting from the 10-day Ganesh festival being celebrated from August 27 this year.

title: Man Arrested For Uploading Obscene Videos Of Women On Instagram
content: Bengaluru Police on Thursday arrested a 19-year-old man on charges of uploading obscene videos of women on the social media platform Instagram.

title: Ekitike signs for Slot's new-look Liverpool team
content: Hugo Ekitike joins arsenal from Eintracht Frankfurt . the 23-year-old is the latest signing for arne slot's revamped side this summer . sources say the move could cost them ¬£79 million ($91m) for the striker .

title: Thailand-Cambodia face-off: Borders shut, F-16 deployed, civilians killed
content: Recent clashes between Thailand and Cambodia over disputed border territories near ancient temples have escalated, resulting in casualties and diplomatic breakdowns. Thailand expelled the Cambodian ambassador following a landmine incident, while Cambodia retaliated by downgrading ties. Military exchanges intensified, with both sides accusing each other of aggression, including airstrikes and artillery fire.

title: 'Did HC apply mind?' SC slams K'taka court over bail to Darshan in murder case
content: The Supreme Court expressed strong displeasure with the Karnataka High Court's handling of actor Darshan's bail in the Renukaswamy murder case. Justice Pardiwala questioned the High Court's approach. He suggested the bail order resembled an acquittal. The Karnataka government sought cancellation of Darshan's bail. Renukaswamy was allegedly abducted and murdered in Bengaluru.

title: Planning a US trip? Trump's new policy may add extra Rs 20k to your visa cost - check details
content: The Trump administration's new policy introduces a $250 "visa integrity fee" for non-immigrant visa applicants, impacting tourists, students, and business travelers from countries like India and China. This fee, in addition to the existing $185 application cost, raises concerns within the tourism industry, with leaders fearing it will deter international visitors.

title: Donald Trump: I wanted to break up Nvidia, before I learnt ‚Ä¶
content: Former US President Donald Trump initially considered breaking up AI chip giant Nvidia to foster competition, but abandoned the plan after advisors highlighted the immense difficulty. Trump learned about Nvidia's dominance and CEO Jensen Huang's achievements, leading to a change in stance. Subsequently, the Trump administration permitted Nvidia to resume selling H20 AI chips to China, reversing earlier restrictions.

title: Training, safety issues: DGCA slaps Air India with 4 show-cause notices
content: The DGCA has issued a stern warning to Air India, threatening action over safety violations, including crew fatigue management and training protocols. The regulator cited 29 violations, such as insufficient pilot rest, poor simulator training compliance, and inadequate crew on international routes. This follows Air India's self-reporting of issues after a plane crash in Ahmedabad.

title: Burning fuselage found: Russian plane with 49 on board crashes; no survivors
content: A plane carrying 50 individuals disappeared in Russia's far east on Thursday after losing contact with air traffic control. Operated by Angara airline, the aircraft was nearing Tynda in the Amur region, bordering China. Communication ceased just kilometers from its destination, prompting immediate concern and initiating search efforts to locate the missing aircraft and its passengers.

title: Locals thrash 'drunk' Indore cop for 'visiting' married woman‚Äôs house
content: In Indore's Khajrana area, a sub-inspector named Suresh Bunkar faced a brutal assault by women and locals after being found inside a woman's house early Thursday. Accused of being drunk and misbehaving, he was beaten, and attempts were made to strip him.

title: World's largest asset manager BlackRock sends 'China diktat' to employees
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant likely to be ruled out of the series
content: Team India faces a significant setback in the crucial fourth Test against England as Rishabh Pant is likely out due to a foot injury sustained on Day 1. Scans revealed a possible fracture after he was struck by a Chris Woakes delivery. Ishan Kishan is a potential replacement. Pant's injury compounds India's worries, especially after his recent finger issue.

title: Donald Trump‚Äôs indicates he won‚Äôt go below 15% tariff rate; says 'we‚Äôll have a straight‚Ä¶'
content: US President Donald Trump has signaled a potential shift in trade strategy, suggesting a baseline tariff of 15% for most nations, potentially reaching 50% for countries with strained relations. This move marks a departure from pursuing individual trade agreements, with Trump indicating tariff letters as completed deals.

title: This Filipino couple got married in a submerged church; here's why
content: In a remarkable display of resilience, a Filipino couple exchanged vows in a flooded church near Manila, highlighting the country's struggle with chronic flooding. The wedding proceeded despite knee-deep water caused by monsoon rains and Typhoon Wipha, symbolizing the couple's commitment amidst adversity.

title: Google results: $10 billion that has spooked Wall Street and investors
content: Alphabet exceeded expectations in the second quarter, driven by strong growth in Google's core search business and Google Cloud. Despite the positive results, investors initially reacted negatively to the announcement of increased capital expenditures, particularly a $10 billion boost for 2025.

title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Loktantra, not Loktantar‚Äô: BJP mocks spelling error in oppn banner
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has criticized the opposition for a spelling error on a banner during a protest concerning electoral roll revisions in Bihar. The opposition alleges that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls is being misused to suppress votes.

title: Gokarna cave saga: HC halts deportation of Russian woman‚Äôs kids
content: The Karnataka High Court has temporarily halted the deportation of two Russian children, acting on a petition citing their welfare and the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child. This decision came after the children and their mother were found in Gokarna, with the court emphasizing the need for a detailed hearing and document verification before any deportation action.

title: 'We are going to come for you': Rahul Gandhi's message to EC on Bihar SIR
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of enabling electoral fraud in Karnataka, claiming to possess ‚Äú100% proof‚Äù of voter manipulation. He alleged voter deletions, unauthorized additions, and suspicious new voters. Gandhi also targeted the Standardisation of Electoral Rolls drive in Bihar, warning the Election Commission of consequences.

title: TMC worker hacked to death in West Bengal
content: In West Bengal's Murshidabad district, a Trinamool Congress activist, Sasthi Ghosh, was allegedly murdered by unidentified assailants. Ghosh was attacked with a sharp tool while returning home, leading to his death at a nearby hospital. While a property dispute is suspected, Ghosh‚Äôs family claims the attack was politically motivated, prompting a police investigation and manhunt for the accused.

title: ‚ÄòReal war‚Äô: North Korea calls for preparedness for military action ‚Äòanytime‚Äô
content: Kim Jong Un has called on North Korean soldiers to be ready for war. He oversaw an artillery drill. North Korea continues to support Russia in the Ukraine war. Reports suggest North Korean soldiers are deployed in Russia. Some have been killed fighting for Russia. Russia warned the US, South Korea, and Japan against forming alliances against North Korea.

title: 'Well-planned scheme to siphon off public money': ED raids Anil Ambani
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is conducting a large-scale investigation into the Reliance Anil Ambani Group (RAAGA) companies, involving 35 premises and 50 companies. The probe centers on the alleged laundering of approximately Rs 3,000 crore received as loans from Yes Bank between 2017 and 2019. ED found gross violations in loan approvals, including backdated documents and lack of due diligence.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Pant's absence is a 25% swing to England' ‚Äì Vaughan on India's setback
content: Vice-captain Rishabh Pant's injury on Day 1 of the fourth Test is a major setback for India, potentially jeopardizing their chances of leveling the series against England. Pant's absence, after being hurt attempting a reverse sweep, removes a key batter and wicketkeeper, significantly impacting India's batting depth and overall strategy.

title: US sanctions warnings unheeded: Indian firm exports explosive compound to Russia
content: Despite warnings of potential US sanctions, an Indian firm exported $1.4 million worth of HMX, a military-grade explosive, to Russia in December. India maintains its historical military and economic partnerships with Moscow whilst strengthening its alliance with the United States.

title: Saiyaara box office: Film takes a slow start on Thursday
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama Saiyaara has become a blockbuster, earning an impressive Rs 155.24 crore net in India within its first week. Powered by fresh talent and soulful music, the film exceeded expectations, achieving remarkable daily collections and holding strong even on weekdays. Saiyaara's success is particularly noteworthy as it was achieved without established superstars.

title: Chess : Divya one step away from historic WC title; but all she wants is 'sleep'
content: India‚Äôs 19-year-old chess prodigy Divya Deshmukh created history by becoming the first Indian to reach the FIDE Women‚Äôs World Cup final. In a five-hour battle, she defeated third seed Tan Zhongyi, securing her first GM norm, a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament, and $35,000. ‚ÄúI just need sleep,‚Äù she said.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Man gropes, kisses college student at market; arrested
content: In east Bengaluru, an 18-year-old college student was harassed while shopping for necessities. A stranger approached, forcibly kissed her, and touched her inappropriately before she managed to escape. Traumatized, the girl reported the incident to the police, who are now investigating using CCTV footage and have registered a case against the perpetrator.

title: 5 dead, around 20 injured as bus falls into gorge near Mandi
content: A devastating bus accident took place near Maseran, Sarkaghat. The incident, occurring about 60 km from Mandi, led to the loss of five lives. Around 20 individuals suffered injuries, with several in critical condition at Sarkaghat hospital. SP Mandi Sakshi Verma is leading the police and local administration in rescue efforts. The authorities are providing relief to the affected.

title: Woman dances on bonnet of moving car in Navi Mumbai for reel; booked
content: Navi Mumbai police detained a woman, Nazmeen Sulde, and her friend, Al-fesh Shaikh, after a video went viral showing Sulde dancing on the bonnet of a moving car while Shaikh drove. The incident, filmed by a passing motorist, led police to trace the car through CCTV footage. They have been booked under Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita and Motor Vehicle Act.

title: Assam PWD engineer dies by suicide over pressure to clear fake bills
content: A 30-year-old female assistant engineer in Assam's Bongaigaon tragically died by suicide, alleging pressure from two senior PWD officials to pass fraudulent bills. In a note, she cited immense mental stress due to being forced to approve payments for incomplete work.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Bits-and-pieces won‚Äôt win you Tests' - Sidhu questions Thakur‚Äôs selection
content: Former Indian cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has criticised the team management's decision to include Shardul Thakur in the fourth Test against England. Sidhu questioned the reliance on 'bits-and-pieces' players in Test cricket, emphasising the need for specialists. He argued that Thakur is not utilised effectively as a bowler and expressed concerns about compromising bowling strength for batting depth.

title: Odisha train derails near Sambalpur
content: The Shalimar-Sambalpur Mahima Gosain Express experienced a minor derailment near Sambalpur City Station on Thursday morning. The rear trolley of a general coach derailed at a very slow speed. Fortunately, no injuries or casualties were reported, and the train has resumed its journey to Sambalpur. Railway officials and police are currently at the site to investigate.

title: McPatel vs McDonald‚Äôs: Ahmedabad brand fights for 'Mc' identity
content: McPatel Foods, an Ahmedabad-based company, has taken McDonald's to court over the use of the prefix 'Mc'. McPatel, which sells French fries, accuses McDonald's of issuing groundless threats regarding its trademark. The local company seeks to prevent the fast-food giant from objecting to its use of 'Mc', arguing it's a generic term meaning 'son of' and honors the Patel community.

title: FIR against Prashant Kishor, 2,000 others; tensions rise after police lathi-charge
content: Following a gherao of the Bihar Vidhan Sabha, an FIR has been lodged against Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor, key party members, and approximately 2,000 unidentified individuals. The charges include scuffling with police and violating prohibitory orders.

title: 'I just hope it‚Äôs not a ...': Ex-cricketer fears worst as Pant injury rocks India
content: Aakash Chopra voiced significant apprehension regarding Rishabh Pant's injury during the fourth Test, labeling it potentially "serious." Pant retired hurt after a blow to his foot, raising concerns about his return. Chopra cautioned that Pant's absence, particularly with the new ball approaching, could severely impact India's chances, emphasising the need for a substantial first-innings score to avoid trouble.

title: Atheist Krishna passes away: Who was the popular social media creator?
content: Radhakrishna Panga, known online as Atheist Krishna, tragically passed away on July 23, 2025, at the age of 29 due to pneumonia. The popular social media content creator, admired for his humorous and thought-provoking memes, was being treated in Vishakhapatnam. His work resonated widely, earning praise from figures like Prime Minister Narendra Modi and actor Akshay Kumar.

title: 'We‚Äôll break this guy up‚Ä¶.': When Trump wanted to break up Nvidia but he didn‚Äôt; here‚Äôs why
content: US President Donald Trump considered breaking up Nvidia to foster competition in the AI chip sector, but ultimately decided against it after advisors highlighted the complexities involved. Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, has praised Trump's AI strategy, and the company recently received permission to resume chip sales to China.

title: Dhankhar resigns: Has the VP been asked to vacate his residence immediately? Govt clarifies
content: Following Jagdeep Dhankhar's unexpected resignation as Vice President, the government refuted claims that he was compelled to immediately vacate his official residence. Opposition parties are questioning the circumstances surrounding his departure, suggesting potential pressure to step down despite the official reason being health concerns. The Election Commission has begun the process to elect a new vice president.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Sai must own No.3 spot' - Ashwin gives blunt verdict on Karun's promotion
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has criticised India's team management for promoting Karun Nair to No. 3, arguing it negatively impacted his mindset. Ashwin praised Sai Sudharsan's composed 61 in the fourth Test, highlighting his solidity and mental strength. Ashwin believes Sudharsan should own the No. 3 spot and also pointed out a technical area for improvement in Sudharsan's batting.

title: Vigilantes stop delivery app rider, ask customer not to eat ‚Äònon-veg‚Äô
content: In Ghaziabad, Bajrang Dal members were caught on video stopping a Blinkit delivery rider, demanding to inspect his order, and berating him for delivering non-vegetarian food to a customer during Shravan. They then pressured the customer, until learning she was Christian. The group also allegedly coerced a store into halting non-veg sales.

title: Second hate attack in 2 days: Hindu temple defaced in Australia with racist graffiti
content: A Hindu temple and Asian-operated businesses in Melbourne were defaced with racist graffiti, sparking a police investigation into hate-motivated attacks. The incidents, condemned by authorities and community leaders, are being treated as linked. This follows a separate racist assault in Adelaide, where an Indian man was brutally attacked after being told to "f--- off, Indian."

title: 'Bihar does not take him seriously': BJP mocks Tejashwi's 'poll boycott' threat
content: The BJP has strongly criticized RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's suggestion of a possible election boycott in Bihar, viewing it as a sign of the Mahagathbandhan's fear of defeat. The BJP claims Yadav's opposition to the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls failed to gain public support.

title: Ammonia leak scare in Mumbai: 3,000kg tank's faulty valve triggers major alert
content: A ammonia gas leak occurred at Mahananda Dairy in Goregaon. The leak came from a tank due to a faulty valve. Authorities responded quickly to contain the situation. The electrical supply was cut off as a precaution. Fire brigade and HAZMAT teams worked to stop the leak. The area was cordoned off for safety.

title: Bengaluru terror alert: How alert bus stand worker blew lid off CM event bomb plot
content: Just days before a high-profile event with the CM and deputy CM in attendance, Bengaluru police were alerted to an abandoned bag containing six gelatine sticks and detonators at a private bus stand in KR Market. The discovery, made by a toilet in-charge, prompted an extensive search by the anti-sabotage squad, though no further explosives were found.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You don't get carted off if ...' ‚Äì Ex-England captain on Pant's injury
content: Rishabh Pant's injury scare has cast a shadow over India's fourth Test hopes at Old Trafford. A painful blow to his right foot forced him to retire hurt, raising concerns about his further participation in the game and potentially the series.

title: 'Backdoor sabotage': Siddaramaiah slams Goa CM over remarks on Mahadayi project
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has strongly criticized Goa CM Pramod Sawant's remarks regarding the Mahadayi river water project, deeming them an insult to the people of Karnataka. Karnataka vows to fight for its rightful share of the project legally, politically, and morally, emphasizing the project's importance for North Karnataka's drinking water needs.

title: India at UN backs two-state solution in Gaza; calls for hostage release
content: India has called for renewed dialogue and diplomacy to achieve peace in the Middle East, emphasizing that temporary pauses in hostilities are insufficient. Addressing the UN Security Council, Ambassador Harish Parvathaneni stressed the need for a ceasefire, release of hostages, and a two-state solution.

title: Why are US-funded contraceptives being burned in France?
content: A stockpile of US-funded contraceptives, valued at nearly $10 million and intended for developing countries, is set to be destroyed in France. The decision follows the US government's rejection of offers to repurpose the supplies, which have been sitting unused since a Trump-era foreign aid freeze.

title: One month until college football: Swing games for every Top 25 team
content: a month away from college football, we asked our reporters to single out one contest for each of our post-spring Top 25 teams that could swing their season one way or the other . some will come in major nonconference battles over the first couple of weeks, some are more traditional league games that could set the tone for the things to come .

title: Dharmasthala burial probe: Home Minister adds to confusion by saying some officers want to be excused from SIT, but no official communication yet
content: Dr .Parameshwara said that he is aware about DCP (CAR) Soumyalatha S.K.‚Äôs desire to be excused from being a part of the SIT for personal reasons, but there is no official communication yet

title: Trinamool Congress activist hacked to death in Bengal‚Äôs Murshidabad
content: The reason behind the killing could be personal enmity over property matters but the exact motive will be known following an investigation, a police officer said

title: Harshvardhan Jain: the ‚Äòfake Diplomat‚Äô who ran ‚Äòembassy‚Äô in Ghaziabad and his controversial past
content: The London educated Harshvardhan Jain was arrested in 2012 for unlawfulling possessing a satellite phone.

title: ED raids 'fake' call centres duping foreigners on pretext of offering tech solutions in Chandigarh
content: The searches were launched on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday in Chandigarh and adjoining cities of Mohali in Punjab and Panchkula in Haryana under the provisions of the PMLA

title: Connectivity problems between rest of Karnataka and the ‚ÄòWest of Karnataka‚Äô for decades reflects poorly on State: NMPA Chairman
content: Every year, the connectivity issue is being discussed without there being any solution, says A. V. Ramana

title: 100% proof of ECI allowing cheating, will not allow poll body to get away with it: Rahul Gandhi
content: I want to send a message to the Election Commission ‚Äî if you thing you are going to get away with this, if your officers think they are going to get away with this, you are mistaken... says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Supreme Court to hear West Bengal challenge to HC stay on fresh OBC list exercise on July 28
content: The Bench listed the case for hearing on July 28. ‚ÄúThe contempt should not go on,‚Äù Mr. Sibal urged. The Chief Justice indicated that the court would pass orders on Monday

title: School Cafe project gains ground in schools in Kerala‚Äôs Kannur with low-cost meals and study support
content: Following the success of the first Scoofe at Kannadiparmba Government Higher Secondary School, the initiative is being expanded to all schools in Kannur

title: Can't allow dead, those who have permanently migrated to be on voters' list: CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar said allowing ineligible people to vote, first in Bihar and later in the entire country, is against the Constitution

title: MLS, minus Messi, beats Liga MX in All-Star Game
content: MLS has defeated Liga MX three times in four tries . last year, the MLS All-Stars won 4-1 in Columbus, Ohio . MLS's james rodrguez also chose not to play in the game .

title: PMK founder Ramadoss seeks ban on Anbumani‚Äôs upcoming padayatra
content: Mr. Ramadoss said the police should stop Mr. Anbumani from taking out the padayatra as it would give rise to law and order issues in north Tamil Nadu

title: Bengaluru to host international space leadership meet Karman Week 2025¬†in October
content: This year‚Äôs selected delegation includes representatives from Axiom Space, Airbus, the Saudi Space Agency, the UK Space Agency, and the Kenya Space Agency

title: Food delivery executive arrested for filming women on Bengaluru roads
content: The social media monitoring cell of the Bengaluru police took cognizance and a suo motu case was registered

title: Woman police officer in Kerala booked, suspended for embezzling over ‚Çπ16 lakh from fine amounts
content: The accused, a senior civil police officer, has been booked for the offences of forgery, using a forged document as genuine, criminal breach of trust by a public servant and cheating under the IPC, according to FIR

title: Supreme Court asks HC to hear Bhopal gas victims‚Äô claim of ‚Äòmisclassification‚Äô of illnesses on merits
content: A Bench of Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justice Vinod Chandran asked the High Court to decide the case on its own merits. The apex court clarified that it had not ventured into the merits of the plea.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: Opposition protests stall proceedings for fourth day
content: Opposition members protested demanding a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar

title: PM Modi London visit LIVE: India and U.K. sign Free Trade Agreement
content: India‚Äôs landmark free trade pact with the U.K. will benefit it significantly as the deal will ensure the elimination of tariffs on approximately 99% of tariff lines, covering nearly 100% of the trade value

title: Supreme Court stays Mumbai blasts case verdict; says convicts need not surrender
content: State pushed for stay, arguing observation in the Bombay HC verdict would impact current MCOCA trials

title: Ex-Punjab police officer sentenced to 10-year rigorous imprisonment in 1993 fake encounter case
content: The CBI, which carried out the investigation on the directions of the Supreme Court in 1995, found that the two unidentified militants who were killed in the encounter were actually two police constables

title: Telangana factory blast: Disbursed ‚Çπ10 lakh each to families of 15 dead, says Sigachi¬†
content: Sigachi had announced earlier that an ex gratia compensation of ‚Çπ1 crore to the families of the deceased. The remaining will be disbursed in a phased and structured manner.

title: Enforcement Directorate searches multiple locations in a case allegedly involving Anil Ambani group companies
content: More than 35 premises in Mumbai and Delhi of 50 companies and about 25 persons are being searched under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), they said

title: Kerala rains: Cyclone Wipha likely to bring heavy rain across State; orange alert for two districts, yellow for seven
content: Rainfall, winds expected to further strengthen from Friday as remnants of tropical cyclone Wipha over north Bay of Bengal have taken the shape of a low-pressure system

title: Andhra Pradesh will become a strategic node in ‚ÄòIndia-UAE economic corridor‚Äô, says UAE Minister Abdulla Al Marri
content: Stating that he is astonished with its infrastructure, availability of natural resources, especially rivers and long coastline, rich human capital, and good connectivity, he says he will facilitate dialogues that bring in synergies and investments, including venture capital, to the State

title: India calls for ceasefire in Gaza, says intermittent pauses ‚Äònot enough‚Äô
content: Underlining that the way ahead is clear, and highlighting India‚Äôs consistent position in this regard, India‚Äôs Permanent Representative to the U.N. Ambassador said the ongoing human suffering must not be allowed to continue

title: Achieve sustainable development but not by bulldozing forests: Supreme Court tells Telangana
content: ‚ÄúI am myself an advocate for sustainable development, but that doesn‚Äôt mean that overnight you should employ 30 bulldozers and clear all the jungle,‚Äù Chief Justice Gavai said

title: Railways to launch portal for Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members to book reserved tickets online
content: The development of software for booking reserved tickets online by sitting as well as former Parliamentarians has been taken up. This will facilitate them to book/cancel the ticket online as per their convenience

title: What India needs from U.K. is another FTA ‚Äî Fugitive Transfer Agreement: Congress‚Äô dig at government
content: Congress said that what India needs from U.K. is the announcement of another and more effective FTA ‚Äî Fugitive Transfer Agreement

title: Dam on upper reaches Brahmaputra will not impact India, Bangladesh: China
content: Playing down the concerns of the lower riparian states, the Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson said that they have cooperated with India and Bangladesh by sharing hydrological data, flood prevention, disaster alleviation

title: Devendra Fadnavis to inaugurate Kusumagaraj Marathi language centre at JNU
content: Maharashtra government wants to construct an equestrian statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in JNU campus

title: Thousands in Kerala offer ‚Äòbali tharpanam‚Äô on Karkidaka Vavu to honour ancestors and departed souls
content: Hundreds, including senior citizens, women and children, throng beachfronts, riversides, and bathing ghats under an overcast sky, revering their ancestors and the recently dead

title: Opposition may boycott Bihar poll, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: The RJD leader¬†alleged the Election Commission is for ‚Äúworking at the behest of BJP and ruling NDA‚Äù and might boycott the polls after taking feedback from people and alliance partners

title: India sends burn injury specialists to Bangladesh to assist air crash survivors
content: Two burn injury specialists and a nursing assistant from India‚Äôs topmost burn injury hospitals ‚Äì Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital and Safdarjung Hospital ‚Äì reached Dhaka to help the injured

title: India's mobile phone exports rise 127 times to ‚Çπ2 lakh crore in 10 years
content: Minister of State for Electronics and IT Jitin Prasada said that 75% of the total mobile phone demand in India was met through imports in 2014-15, which has now dropped to 0.02% in 2024-25

title: Damned if they do, or don‚Äôt: AIADMK‚Äôs impossible choice on alliance with BJP
content: The regional party‚Äôs tie up with the BJP offers possible short-term gains but comes with the risk of losing identity and voter base

title: India, China review border situation, prepare for Special Representatives dialogue
content: The MEA said India and China prepared for the next round of the Special Representatives' talks on the boundary issue to be held in India later this year

title: Phone assembly domestic value addition is 23%, new report claims
content: The report by the Centre for Development Studies, Thiruvananthapuram, counters existing assessments of domestic value addition in mobile phone assembly

title: BJP partner TIPRA Motha demands Bihar-like SIR in Tripura
content: A delegation of the party, headed by its founder Pradyot Kishore Manikya, demanded an extensive survey to identify the illegal voters on the electoral rolls

title: India‚Äôs press and media ecosystem expands with over 1.55 lakh publications and 908 private TV channels: govt.
content: The number of private satellite TV channels have also increased from 821 in 2014-15 to 908 in 2024-25, govt said

title: Former Trinamool MP Jawhar Sircar demands ‚Äúanswers‚Äù for animals missing from Alipore Zoo¬†
content: Wildlife enthusiasts of the city express concerns over ‚Äúdisappearance‚Äù of hundreds of creatures from Kolkata‚Äôs famous Alipore Zoo and the e-auction of a part of the zoo land

title: Andhra Pradesh poised to emerge as a model for other States in agrivoltaics, says NSEF CEO¬†
content: Combining solar energy with farming can not only provide farmers with an additional source of income but also help them in¬†adapting to changing climate conditions, thereby ensuring sustainable growth in the two sectors, says Subrahmanyam

title: Rajasthan formulating five-year plan for domestic piped natural gas supply infrastructure
content: The supply of cooking gas for domestic consumption through underground pipelines is a relatively new concept in Rajasthan

title: AI Express plane aborts takeoff at Delhi airport due to technical snag
content: The source said that the pilot decided to abort takeoff as there was a glitch with the screens displaying the speed parameters in the cockpit

title: More Nagaland bodies brace for influx of people evicted in Assam
content: The Konyak Students‚Äô Union wants its volunteers to guard the interstate border against possible movement of people

title: ED attaches shares worth ‚Çπ127 crore in case linked to ex-Trinamool MP
content: Alchemist firms allegedly raised ‚Çπ1,848 crore from unsuspecting investors and later misappropriated the funds

title: Left parties hold procession against the harassment of W.B. migrants in other States
content: Calcutta High Court directed the Odisha government to file an affidavit in opposition to the contentions in habeas corpus petitions that two Bengali-speaking migrant workers from West Bengal were illegally detained in the neighbouring State

title: Himachal CM asks Centre to expedite matters pertaining to State‚Äôs civil aviation sector
content: The Chief Minister has urged the Ministry to recommend the proposed expansion of the airport in the State‚Äôs Kangra

title: Services under ‚ÄòSnehagramam‚Äô project for endosulfan victims enter second phase
content: Snehagramam is being developed on 25 acres provided by the Planatation Corporation as compensation in Muliyar grama panchayat

title: Female trainee constables protest at U.P.‚Äôs Gorakhpur centre over basic amenities, abusive language, cameras
content: While administrative officers dispersed the protestors who were blocking the road and directed them back inside the centre, the recruits protested outside the administrative building, demanding addressing of their basic demands

title: Kauvery Hospital opens specialised HCM clinic at its facility in Vadapalani
content: The clinic aims to streamline access, improve clinical outcomes and offer focused, affordable care for a complex condition that often requires cross-specialty coordination.

title: Modi begins U.K. visit, trade deal to be inked today
content: The deal would boost trade between the two countries by ¬£25.5 billion each year, a U.K. government statement said

title: Residents of localities along ECR complain that civic works have turned many roads slushy
content: The common complaint is that the roads were cut for only about 5 ft width, but, the dug up earth was piled and left alongside.

title: Former Deputy CM Dushyant Chautala criticises Haryana‚Äôs law and order under Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini
content: Mr. Chautala said that Mr. Saini seemed to have ‚Äúno control over the police‚Äù and the law-and-order situation had deteriorated after he took over as the Home Minister

title: Bihar police lathi charge on protesting Jan Suraaj workers in Patna, many get injured¬†
content: Losing cool over police action, party founder Prashant Kishor said he will make it difficult for the government to function even for a day

title: Parliamentary panel faults Centre‚Äôs move to disengage 7-decade-old NIRDPR
content: The reputed autonomous organisation has been known for its expertise in building capacities of rural development functionaries, elected representatives, financial institutions and community-based organisations

title: Consider watermelon cultivators‚Äô plea for compensation, Madras High Court directs T.N. govt
content: They claimed to have suffered losses due to a scare created by food safety officials regarding alleged injection of chemicals to enhance colour and sweetness

title: BPCL-KR urged to consider Ayyankuzhi residents‚Äô demand for land acquisition
content: Over 30 families remain sandwiched on a 9.4-acre strip between two major public sector units ‚Äî Hindustan Organic Chemicals Limited and BPCL-KR

content: Worn-out seawall and geobags add to the plight of residents on the 5-km stretch between Puthenthode and Kattikadavu

content: The bench made it clear that the BBMP will have to refund the fees that it collects during the pendency of the proceedings if the final judgement on the appeal goes against the BBMP
